Description: A worn blade with flaking edges. Still good enough to scare off slimebats.
Carved from ironwood and nailed with steel teeth. Surprisingly dependable.
Forged from spare chain loops. It clinks louder than it cuts.
Shaped to jab, not swing. Perfect for stabbing through swamp armor.
A simple core blade with a faint internal shimmer. A favorite among trainees.
Thin and light, yet unnaturally strong. Whistles on wide arcs.
Jagged like broken glass. You’ll need a steady hand and a lot of gauze.
Warms the air around it. Once used to light torches on expedition trails.
Decorated with curling vine patterns. Draws blood like a thorn.
Faint lunar etchings glow softly in the dark. Feels lighter under starlight.
Kicks up air as it swings. Makes more noise than damage — for now.
Covered in forged briars. Cuts as it drags. Feared in the undergroves.
Its polished finish reflects starlight in dungeons. Favored by lightseers.
Blackened tip, cool to the touch. Used by fire-walkers of Ember Steppe.
The hilt smells faintly of earth. Born from jungle-forged steel.
Leaves a faint echo after striking. Those hit feel... slower.
Ornate but deadly. Used in ceremonial duels that rarely ended peacefully.
A twisted core blade once wielded in the Rot Wars. Resists corrosion.
The darker it is, the faster it cuts. Whispers when held at dusk.
Sparks on metal contact. Loud, erratic, but effective.
Crafted from old wood and thorn. Arrows buzz more than they fly.
Drips resin from the limbs. Makes quivers stickier than they should be.
Light and wind-tuned. Hums softly when drawn.
Found buried in marsh soil. Pulls just a little left with every shot.
Dimly radiant under moonlight. A good companion for late hunts.
Wobbly-looking but weirdly accurate. Made from scrap and luck.
Tensioned too tight, it bites back on misfires. Often wrapped in rags.
Warm to the touch. A popular starter bow for cozy rangers.
Flexible frame lashed with living vines. Grows faint leaves over time.
Makes no sound. Even the arrows seem surprised when they hit.
Glimmers when turned sideways. Loses shine in direct moonlight.
Quivers with recoil. Once used in desert duels at dawn.
String woven from starlit spider silk. It resets itself overnight.
Burnt wood, still glowing faintly. Arrows smell like campfire.
Fires sticky-tipped arrows that tangle in enemy cloaks.
Shots make no noise. Even the wind forgets they passed.
Tends to fog when drawn. Excellent in ambush-heavy regions.
Mossy and damp. Arrows grow fluff if left too long.
Strikes with heavy force. Arrows hit like falling fruit.
Carved beneath lunar eclipse. Favored by owl-eyed archers.
A snapped stick with ambition. Best for misfires and sparks.
Smells of wet wood and burnt paper. Casts minor but honest spells.
Wrapped in creeping green. Useful for growing herbs or headaches.
Smolders faintly. Will ignite scrolls if held too long.
Condensation gathers at its tip. Radiates sleepy warmth.
Translucent wood pulsing with syrupy light. Attracts beetles.
Hard to focus on. Glitches slightly between planes when idle.
Covered in natural barbs. Enhances curses by at least 12%.
Leaves a trail of motes when waved. Best for dramatic exits.
Jerks forward on its own when spells are strong.
Used to stir memory pools. Whispers unintelligibly when near graves.
Glows red when angry. Locks fire magic into stable orbs.
A staff of dry petals and void. Blossoms only in nightmares.
Used to walk on air. Mostly effective on small stairs.
Rains puffs when slammed. Causes sneezing if used too frequently.
The wood murmurs gently. No one knows what it’s saying.
Shines through walls. Sometimes inconvenient, always dazzling.
Dotted with glowing fruit. Casting causes one to vanish.
Covered in prismatic shards. Shoots rays that taste faintly of ozone.
Made from silk and sighs. It directs energy like a lazy river.
A helm infused with shadowed energy, radiating an aura of corruption and decay.
A sleek and ethereal helm crafted from voidium, granting enhanced agility and perception.
A heavy helm forged from concentrated voidium, exuding an unearthly and intimidating presence.
A protective helm forged by the ancient Vorloran, symbolizing resilience and vigilance.
This helm sharpens awareness, allowing its wearer to detect unseen threats with ease.
A hood woven with eldritch threads, crackling with chaotic magic for arcane defense and power.
A light crown blessed by unseen winds, offering unmatched grace and agility to its wearer.
A crown imbued with eternal frost, protecting the wearer with icy resilience.
A sturdy helm rooted in the strength of the earth, granting steadfast protection.
Forged in molten fire, this fiery helm emanates the raw rage of Ragnar’s forge.
A corrupted armor forged from shadowed materials, emanating an aura of decay.
A sleek armor made of voidium, designed for agility and enhanced with ethereal energy.
A heavy armor forged from condensed voidium, radiating an intimidating and otherworldly presence.
Forged by the ancient Vorloran, this plate embodies strength and resilience in battle.
This armor sharpens its wearer’s awareness, aiding in detecting unseen threats.
Arcane robes crackling with chaotic magic, favored by spellcasters seeking unbridled power.
A light and graceful armor, blessed by unseen winds to grant unparalleled mobility in combat.
Infused with eternal frost, this plate can freeze incoming strikes, making its wearer nearly untouchable.
A sturdy plate forged from the strongest earthly materials, offering unshakable defense in any encounter.
Born from the molten core of Ragnar’s forge, this armor burns with the rage of a thousand flames.
A basic shield of slimewood, perfect for beginners.
Reinforced with slime-bronze, offering reliable protection.
Made with hardened materials to endure greater impacts.
A balanced shield forged with slime-alloy for versatility.
Shadowy and sleek, ideal for silent defenders.
Crafted from resilient muckstone, unusually tough.
Radiates protective light, instilling courage in its wielder.
A frosty shield that chills attackers upon impact.
Burns brightly, deflecting attacks with fiery resilience.
A relic of old, emanating ancient defensive power.
Forged with dragon’s magma shards, unbreakable and fierce.
Crafted from glittering Crystal, as tough as it is radiant.
Enriched with lush, green Crystal of unparalleled strength.
A shield of holy power, blessed with sanctified slime.
A dark shield imbued with chaotic abyssal energies.
Flickering with faint light, mysterious and graceful.
Forged in twilight, carrying the essence of dusk.
Draws strength from those it deflects, eerie and powerful.
Rips through reality, forged from the Nether’s essence.
A legendary shield, said to be forged from the core of slimes.
A coarse, earth-toned cloak worn by foragers of the rootways. Offers modest defense and maximum blend into bogs and thickets.
Dyed in mossgreen threads and rimmed in forestleather, this cape hums faintly when the wind stirs. Beloved by glade scouts.
Once worn by bloodtrackers during the war of Duskroot. Faint traces of rage remain soaked into its weft.
Gold-threaded and flame-hardened, it bears the heraldry of the Firewatch Order. Useful against both blade and glare.
A prestige garb woven for Sun-Chosen tacticians. Radiates faint warmth, even at night.
Cut from frostsilk, its fabric stiffens in cold but never breaks. Trusted by Wind Temple archivists.
Decorative winged shoulders crafted from emberweave. Bestows fire resistance and flightless flair.
Etched with spirals of forgotten glyphs, this deep-violet cloak shimmers with sealed whispers.
Charred at the edges and stitched with phoenixgold. Said to be reborn anew every full moon.
A regal, front-facing cloak set with a soulstone clasp. Crafted for the Slime Regent, said to turn strikes to light.
Worn by those who walked the world before it was ready. It hums faintly with the echoes of first steps.
A fine chain humming with urgency. Work gets done just a little faster.
This strand seems to bend time. Farming and crafting feel nearly instant.
This charm shines brighter the more you learn. XP flows just a bit richer.
An ornate sigil worn by forgotten sages. Accelerates skill gain across the board.
A small locket that rattles with invisible treasures. Doubles your yield... sometimes.
This pulsing gem spills with abundance. When it works, it really works.
Glimmers faintly with ghostly wisdom. Sometimes your lessons repeat themselves.
Every step feels strangely familiar. XP echoes more often than it should.
